website_summaries.verdict: The best high-end power supply to buy when you need better performance and damage protection.
pros: Runs efficiently near the high loads common with powerful gaming setups
Semi-modular design reduces the amount of cables lying around the inside of a computer
cons: The fan is quite noisy when running near the top limits of the power supply

customer_reviews.title: Test before using it.
customer_reviews.text: Was sent to me faulty. Fried my hard drive. I lost all my data. Anything plugged into the 6 pins causes the system not to boot and can short out the device. 250gb Samsung evo gone with all my business data.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M

customer_reviews.title: Very bad build quality ... possible threat of fire  or system damage don’t buy it ...
customer_reviews.text: This piece of .... when first plugged to power made a weird noise and some weird smell , then worked just fine , now after few months of using ... this piece of ... wont stop rattling and buzzing it’s so loud that makes me want to shoot my self in the head .... I inspect it to see where the noise is coming from ... and guess what !!! It wasn’t the fan it’s the board it self .... it has a loose screw inside dancing to the fan moves Now I don’t think this will survive more and am scared it will destroy my system so am replacing it in a couple of days .
customer_reviews.author: RABIH

customer_reviews.title: BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: This PSU is a beast. I have it in my mining rig powering 6x RX580 GPU's and a celeron G3930 CPU. It has held up so far and its quite efficient, pulling around 900w from the wall, so I dont think its too close to being tapped out.
customer_reviews.author: pwnedbygary

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Built Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old 850W Corsair PS decided to give up the ghost and so I decided to purchase this one. I installed the unit into my full sized case and had all of the cables hooked up in less than an hour. The cables that come with the unit are well designed and bend easily. I don't have it in eco mode and there's very little fan noise. All in all a nice power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Kokodude

customer_reviews.title: Killed two hard drive immediately
customer_reviews.text: I want to use two graphic card so i upgrade my Power unit to 1000w. But it killed two of my HDD immediately after i turn it on. No smoke, but you can smell it was burned. A few years family picture and program gone. Im trying to buy the same model of harddrive and the replace the circuits board. Maybe just because im unlucky, im returning it. Very depressed...
customer_reviews.author: Gzbuzz

customer_reviews.title: great semi modular psu
customer_reviews.text: couldn't beat it for the price, sure its not a full modular but who cares. the only plug thats not modular is the main board plug anyways. handy having the other ones modular though that way you can slap them in to suit your build with better cable management. before this one I had a non modular and it was a mess. my brother and I dubbed it "Medusa" and after that one unless the price is so ridiculously low on one I will never own a non modular again. so 5/5 stars for being a nicely priced 1000 watt beast.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Detlor

customer_reviews.title: Arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: Arrived DOA, does not appear to be damaged by shipping. Failed to ship with the circuit tester the manual references. I performed the paperclip test. The PSU makes a quiet "click" but the fan does not come on. Flicked the "eco mode" on and off, nothing happens. For fun I connected it to a PC and applied power, nothing turns on but the quiet "click" when power is first applied. Returning this and buying Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Jmaxix

customer_reviews.title: This power supply is ridiculously loud...
customer_reviews.text: I have used eVGA products for years, including power supplies. Their service is great at times, so I try to stay loyal when it comes to buying new components. I bought two of these for a couple of new builds. These are the loudest, or among the loudest, power supplies I have ever used in 25 years of hobby computer building. Mine must be defective, I am in the process of returning them. When other reviewers say they are loud, believe them. The Eco switch is nice, in that it keeps the fan off under light loads, but most people dont buy high end power supplies because they anticipate light loads...and when the load kicks in....ugh....
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very clean fit into my gaming rig. Plenty of cables and hook-and-loops included for cable management. Silent. Cons: Power toggle switch is very small. Need to see where to place your hand to switch on/off because it gets "hidden" under the much bigger interlock connector. Bottom line: It's a power supply from a known vendor. You expect to deliver what depicted in the technical specs. And it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: The Magician

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older model power supply and was very happy with the modular options in addition to the core grouping. Install was easy and it has been running quietly ever since. Also has plenty of power for anything you can throw at it (within reason). I was too eager and ended up buying it shortly before it went on sale but I was happy with my purchase even with that mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C.

customer_reviews.title: So far working like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: So far working like a champ. I selected this to power my new rig because it was 200 watts above the recommended minimum watts for my setup, and because the deal I got included a free game (visit the vendor site). After several month I have had no issues. Below are the major rig specs of my system for comparison. i7 6700k 32GB ram 2X gigabyte 980ti extreme waterforce GPUs (these are the watercooled OC'd cards) Kraken water cooled system for the CPU ASUS ROG MAXIMUS VIII FORMULA motherboard I expect to be adding a third 980ti without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Meade

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I use this to replace a faulty "800w" power supply in my Cyberpower gaming pc that runs a nVidia RTX 2070 super graphics card..very easy to install...once I felt the weight of this psu I could immediately tell this thing is quality built. This came with more than enough cables than I will ever need, but it's always good to have spares.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable find something else
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a month then it went out. Look at all the other reviews these units 1. Don’t last long 2. Are noisy 3. Have weird coil problems. I just switched motherboards cause mine was bad and it was connected to that build but when I changed motherboards it decided not to work. Luckily I have a spare one that I use for tests to check these things. Thanks EVGA for wasting my time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Slack

customer_reviews.title: Great power supply at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything this power supply brings to the table. EVGA remains a trusted brand in my books. I bought this power supply to fuel my AMD FX 6300 cpu which is overclocked to 4.5GHz and my rx 580 armor mk2 8gb oc gpu. I plan on using the left-over wattage to install a 2nd rx 580mk2 and run a crossfire setup utilizing both gpu's. If you're looking to upgrade to a more high-end build, you're going to need the juice to power it all. This power supply will take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Modular power supplies are the only way to go. This is the first one that I've used in my personal build, and I'll never go back. I love being able to unplug the cables I'm not using and remove them from the PC chassis. It's by far and away a cleaner look and much easier to manage cables. This particular model has power to spare. I'm running a chassis with 8 fans, a monstrous graphics processing unit, and a multi-fan CPU cooler, and this thing isn't breaking a sweat. Operation is clean and quiet. Couldn't ask for better. It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Working great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a subpar PSU. Install was easy and computer booted up with no issues. PSU comes with a 5 year warranty so register right away on EVGA website. If you've never installed one before, follow the instructions so you put the proper cable ends into the PSU. This may be the cause of a lot of 1-2 star reviews. Only about an hour use so far so I'll update in a few weeks for fan noise and efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J.

customer_reviews.title: 4 out of 5 returns!
customer_reviews.text: This is the lowest quality PSU I've ever owned. 4 out of 5 fails. Meanwhile my Corsair and Rose will PSUs are still going strong. Costs $50 to get the EVGA repaired. Never EVGA again!
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power. Not messy
customer_reviews.text: My Build is an FX 8350 @ 4.7GHZ Overclock H100i 16GB DDR3 @2133 GSKILL Ripjaws R9 290X 8gb Toxic Sapphire @1020mhz 5 Desktop fans 4TB WD HD 5400 RPM 2TB WD HD 7200 RPM 240GB Kingston SSD 120GB Kingston SSD Powers all this and has room for more GPUs. Will eventually get a Crossfire or SLI configuration later with this as it can handle it no problem. Wires come separate from case so you can plug in only what you need to power your computer. You don't have extra wires around in your case to block airflow
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Salem

customer_reviews.title: First EVGA product and it failed about a month after
customer_reviews.text: First psu lasted a little over a month before it melted some connectors to my pau. Paid my RMA and evga sent me a new "refurb" unit for exchange. The fan on the refurb is probablly one from a non "quiet" version which depletes the purpose of buying a quiet model, it's quite loud. I'm not really liking supporting a product with these issues
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: evga 1000 watt gq 80+ gold semi modular psu
customer_reviews.text: i have had this power supply for close to two years now and it still works like a champ. it has see 2 different computer builds a fm2 880k with a r 9 390 and my current build ryzen 5 1600 and the same r 9 390. it has a eco mode and has plenty of power to run my very power hungry sapphire r 9 390 8gb. i was going to add a second r 9 390 but gpu prices are stupid crazy so no crossfire until the prices get back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: M. Castorr

customer_reviews.title: High quality quiet, performance
customer_reviews.text: This supply is way more power than I needed, but it was on sale, so I ordered it. The machine is a 4790k, 16GB, 1TB SSD, 2 TB drive, and an Nvidia Titan X. My old supply (650W Corsair) was beginning to squeal under load with the Titan X playing modern games. Nothing bogs this new 1000W supply down. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Product services aided over the phone with the installation. I wanted considerably more power and this gave it to me. It is quiet and as far as I can tell, well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: SS1983

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but is VERY loud when playing games
customer_reviews.text: This power supply has been holding up about a month into me owning it and is working well with my system. I have a 2080ti with a i9-9900k and I've had no problems with crashes or anything of the sort. The only pet peeve I have with this power supply is the REALLY loud buzzing noise that occurs when a decent amount of power is running through it. Instantly when I open up ANY game the buzzing noise commences and is just very annoying. I will probably end up getting a different power supply in the future because of this issue alone.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Its not the most energy efficient PSU on the market, but it performs very well, is a decent price (considering how expensive PSUs have been this year) and is close to silent as far as I can tell. I wasn't in love with the wires (it was very awkward trying to wire up a hard drive and 2 SSDs) that it comes with, but they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Arin Feller

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the first one almost caught on fire. It was installed correctly, no surges happened and my internal PC temperature was normal. After it was replaced it has been running smoothly ever since! My recommendation for first time builders is to keep a fire extinguisher close by!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: My Power supply died in about 3 months. This is unacceptable, very bad quality!
customer_reviews.author: AAReview

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: My computer kept shutting down under load, even not overclocked. I figured it might be the power supply. I have 2 video cards in crossfire mode. Turned out the power supply I had, even though it was also 1000W, couldn't handle the load. With this power supply it works the way it's supposed to. I'm happy! :)
customer_reviews.author: Tengo

customer_reviews.title: Wont buy this again
customer_reviews.text: bought this on Prime Day of 2018, less than a year ago and it is already failing on me, if i plug in an extra peripheral or sata power cable to it, it won't turn on, also if i disable eco mode it won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Started to fail after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: It started to fail (won't turn on sometimes) after three years, but it is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Yerry Batista

customer_reviews.title: 1000w is enough to power a 6GPU mining rig. ...
customer_reviews.text: 1000w is enough to power a 6GPU mining rig. (GPU's turned down to at least 70% power through MSI Afterburner) My problem with this power supply was the GPU power cords. I could only space my cards 3" apart. By using aI was able to space my cards at 4.5" and due to the extra space, the cards run 10 degrees Celcius cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, energy efficient, sound isn’t noticeable. Only thing I dislike is the cables. My buddy bought the same brand with lower wattage but his wires were braided the wires I got were too plain.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Maybe

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. Would not power up computer. Threw in a different psu and computer powered up.
customer_reviews.author: Rectems

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking p/s. Works verywell and VERY low NOISE...
customer_reviews.text: Computer power supply in gaming machine. Needed 1000 watt. This works very well........
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ellison

customer_reviews.title: EVGA 1000 GQ, 80+ Gold 1000W
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy! I told my daughter that a sure way to tell if a power supply is of any quality, that it would be heavy. It was, and it works great. As usual EVGA, good job! Love your Graphics cards as well! maybe i can afford another, one of these days.... ;o)
customer_reviews.author: APOCTHEONE1

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit the 1st x, 2nd unit is working as it should...
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received, when eco-mode is off where the fan will spin constantly, it was constantly making an annoying buzzing sound. Returned it and got a replacement and now it's nice and quiet. So far, it's seems to be working as it should. Will update if anything unusual comes up.
customer_reviews.author: BZB

customer_reviews.title: The most VGA ports of any 1000w. The only ...
customer_reviews.text: The most VGA ports of any 1000w. The only cord that isnt modular is the 24 pin so its about as modular as they come. 5 year warranty. Ive had 1 running at about 800 to 900 watts 24/7 for 3 months and it hasn't melted anything unlike my thermaltake 1000w gold that fused itself to a sata plug and only pulls about 600 to 700. Although these are both 80 plus gold this one puts off significantly less heat than the thermaltake one at higher wattage which can only mean its more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Ucas Rage

customer_reviews.title: It's EVGA of corse it works well
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says it works well. On high demand computers it gets a bit warm [but then I use it 24/7]. As long as you have adequate ventilation in your computer cabinet then you will have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Been there done that

customer_reviews.title: Dive right in, it's a simple change out!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Very compact yet I still have plenty of outlets/power for future upgrades, and the best part was opening the box to find almost all of the wires were flat, so further space was saved there. My only concern was the length of the CPU cables. Instead of giving you two of the same length, they should give you one that's a bit longer than the other; for taller towers with a bottom mounted power supply.
customer_reviews.author: PhatCatJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad Lingering Plastic Smell!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a great power supply so far. I haven't had any issues besides the horribly strong plastic smell that it is emitting from the unit. I got the 1000w power supply so it shouldn't be burning up. I'm way under the total output. I don't know why the smell won't go away. It makes my entire house smell like strong plastic. I thought it would go away after a couple weeks but It's STILL HERE!
customer_reviews.author: Coburns

customer_reviews.title: and enjoy the modular systems to aid in cleaning up the ...
customer_reviews.text: In the past I have gone with PC Power & Cooling PSU but as they're no longer available I went with these, EVGA, and enjoy the modular systems to aid in cleaning up the PCs I build. So far I have had them running for many months, 24/7, and have come across no issues.
customer_reviews.author: This is Me

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: good psu did't blow up like the other one I got this one is made by evga witch i trust with my money and they delivered this psu does not even spin up so it is great for silent builds... the cables are a bit weird but that is not the end of the world this psu it a great value
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Love the modular feature. Allows me to wire up my rig just the way I want it. Very stable output and no problems. Platinum supplies are great but pricey. This is a good compromise. Lower cost, excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rdys

customer_reviews.title: EVGA works!  Forget that Corsair junk
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! Replaced the crap Corsair that burned out after just 3 months. This EVGA is working for over a year with no problems. I'm going with EVGA from now on
customer_reviews.author: Obsidian

customer_reviews.title: Always trust EVGA
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought it when it was on sale when it was $119.99 but regardless, it's still a powerhouse.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PSU for 980 Ti SLI. It works absolutely quietly without a heavy load. Under load, with both GPU training neural networks, I cannot hear any noise coming from the power supply. It worked for almost half a year 24x7 with no problems at all. The only issue I had is that I ordered this power supply to South Korea, but the PSU was delivered with an American plug. EVGA sent me a cable with the correct plug type; however, they said that PSUs on Amazon will always be offered only with American plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: First rate product. Use: Building a pc or replacing worn out / inadequate power supply in existing pc. pro's +has of power, as the specs denote +the plug and play power cords give you the ability to only fill your case with absolutely necessary cords, reducing clutter and allowing for better air flow and cooling. con's -not all cables are as well labeled as you might like.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ps! Everything is labeled and super easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ps! Everything is labeled and super easy to organize. You get TONS of cables!! More than you need. I love the eco mode! I actually thought the ps was broken cause the fan wasn’t turning on....then I read the manual hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: great power supply i loved the fact that it was ...
customer_reviews.text: great power supply i loved the fact that it was modular and easy to intergrate into my computer build the extra wattage should help in the future if i decide to do any further upgrades to my pc.
customer_reviews.author: kevin kraus

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: This product was bad when shipped. I have not been able to get a hold of anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Malstrom

customer_reviews.title: Silent but powerful ;)
customer_reviews.text: Met my requirements and i haven't had a bad experience with EVGA's products or services.
customer_reviews.author: GoodInfo

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: Works. That's what a power supply is supposed to do. Arrived quickly. Would recommend seller.
customer_reviews.author: B2dm2k

customer_reviews.title: works great, for some reason the cables on the 1300w ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, for some reason the cables on the 1300w evga psu are not compatible with these ones, but the 1300 does accept the cables from this model, just an interesting fact im dropping on you guys
customer_reviews.author: iutaro girotto

customer_reviews.title: Perfect PSU for an enthusiast build
customer_reviews.text: Good PSU, feels solid with great sleeves. It has enough plugs for most set ups and more than enough power for SLI and overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pand

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The noise is minimal compared to my last one and the cable management was easier too. With the semi modular setup it saves a lot of room in the basement. I have no problems with it and I’ve been running it for the better part of three weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PSU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to power a cryptocurrency mining machine and it was able to handle 8 AMD RX570 GPUs on it's own. Very silent and efficient - would buy again and recommend it to anyone who needs power at low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Milen Georgiev

customer_reviews.title: It's a good power supply that you know, supplies power.
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these beasts. EVGA makes good stuff and this is no exception. This is the third of these I've bought for various builds and they are always functional/good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Lovely PSU
customer_reviews.text: It works brilliantly, the cables are flexible and manageable, and while the connections from cables to the PSU itself are a little stiff, it's a good thing. They stay, very firmly. 1 thing though- the fan is quiet but actually pulls some serious air, I recommend installing a dust filter or two.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU and very silent
customer_reviews.text: Has more than one year with my 7 GPU 1050TI mining rig without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Demian Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Really Quite, and durable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an incredible power supply. Might be overkill for just about any computer build but now you have room to upgrade without worrying about over energy consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon barkef

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't work right out of the box. I would buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Had it for 2 years now and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had this Power Supply for nearly 2 years now and it still works like a charm. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Luis Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works well out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much no issues with the PSU, only gripe is that the last 4 pins of the motherboard power cable can be separated from the rest, so it's a pain to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Boiledham

customer_reviews.title: DOA on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these power supply's show up as DOA. Amazon made it right and had replaced to first one. When the second arrived and was DOA I called and they refunded the money. Amazon service was awesome! I know this doesn't normally happen as I have 3 other EVGA psu's and they all work flawlessly. I ended up ordering the EVGA supernova 1050g PSU and was extremely happy with it. All in all I would order from EVGA again and again and know that this was a fluke ordeal. Thanks again to Amazon customer support!
customer_reviews.author: D.Stover

customer_reviews.title: This PSU is not producing as much power as the 850 Bronze that I have.
customer_reviews.text: The PSU seemed to work fine with 1 1060 GPU, but when I hooked up the 4th GPU it would just power up, then power down, over and over; the PSU would never start up on it's own and I had to hook up my 850 EVGA bronze, which ran them just fine solo. I am convinced that something is wrong with this PSU and unfortunately I am having to run 2 PSU's to compensate the lack of power generated by this PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to return a item if you are not happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The product was great I will order from this site sgain
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm now
customer_reviews.text: Holds up to all our gaming needs. I bought it because my current computer couldn’t power the monster graphics card I put in. Works like a charm now.
customer_reviews.author: xundrah

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this awhile ago and just tried to install ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this awhile ago and just tried to install it. It did not turn on and took it too the computer shop too see if i missed anything. The computer shop said the psu is dead. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: patrick untalan

customer_reviews.title: Works well,comes with a lot of cables
customer_reviews.text: This 1000w PSU holds up to everything i put it through,especially a crossfire config with Radeon RX 580s
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: EVGA a brand you can trust
customer_reviews.text: Awesome evga does it again. Quiet, cool. 80+ gold for this price I would by 5 more!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Powers my Ryzen processor and GTX 1070 without breaking a sweat.
customer_reviews.author: DeathryderYT

customer_reviews.title: ... to run couple secondhand GPUS and it is working excellent from day one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this EVGA 1000 GQ 80 PLUS GOLD PSU form Amazon on the 22/02/17 to run couple secondhand GPUS and it is working excellent from day one. I tried a new generic 750w PSU on one GPU and it blew my MB and maybe CPU, 5 Stars for EVGA gold star PSU it's workinbg beautifully. Do not use generic PSU on any video cards with power connectors or use any molex cable on PSU with four pins cpnnectors.
customer_reviews.author: Nkurmah Maricheau

customer_reviews.title: Power Supply
customer_reviews.text: The order came in on time, and in good working order.
customer_reviews.author: G. Clark

customer_reviews.title: It looks good, clean and black in color
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. The modular wires are the once that count. The non-modular wires are used anyway. It looks good, clean and black in color. No vegas effects. Just simple. Running a beast of a machine. This thing does not even break a sweat. Buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Verdict still out
customer_reviews.text: Good PWS while it lasted. Sent back to EVGA on an RMA Replacement came and it was DOA. EVGA is sending me a second PWS. Hopefully this one will work
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN SULTON

customer_reviews.title: Ezpz install from a great company
customer_reviews.text: EVGA is top tier for a great price. Best customer service in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon opening
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I'm super disapointed. When I opened the box it didn't even come with the testing mechanism so after I got everything hooked up I learned that the PSU was actually broken. It's a shame when a brand new product just dies right out of the box. In the end I don't think I'll ever go with a EVEGA product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Pragmatic Ogre

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing against EVGA other than the PS was DOA. .
customer_reviews.author: David Satterfield

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good power supply! Quality build at a good price, you get more than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Funte

customer_reviews.title: Best Supply I found in 2016
customer_reviews.text: As a computer technician I will recommend this power unit to any and everyone (for at least the next 2 years) 2016 at the time of review
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I draw 850w continuously off this unit with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and product
customer_reviews.text: I have the powaaaaa. great supply best customer support in answering my questions. The only power supply's I run in all my builds

product_meta.title: EVGA 210-GQ-1000-V1,1000 GQ, 80+ GOLD 1000W, Semi Modular, EVGA ECO Mode, 5 Year Warranty, Power Supply,Black
product_meta.description: Style:GQ| Size:1000WIntroducing the latest in the EVGA power supply line-up; the GQ series. These power supplies take some of the best features from EVGA's award winning power supplies, like EVGA ECO fan mode for near silent operation, Japanese Capacitor Design and a highly efficient design, at an excellent value. These new power supplies are 80 Plus Gold rated and offer an outstanding 5 Year that's backed by world class EVGA support.Operating Temperature : 0° to 50° C. Material :Aluminium. Connector Quantity = 24 Pin ATX 1x, EPS (CPU) 2x 8pin (4+4), PCIe 10x 8pin (6+2), SATA 12x, Four-Pin Peripheral 3x, Floppy 2x.
feature_bullets: 80 PLUS Gold certified, with 90 percent (115VAC) / 92 percent (220VAC~240VAC) efficiency or higher under typical loads
Fan Size / Bearing: 135mm Fluid Dynamic Bearing and operating temperature is 0 degree to 50 degree Celsius
Heavy duty protections, including OVP, UVP, OCP, OPP, SCP, and OTP.Input Frequency Range:50 - 60 Hz
EVGA 1000 GQ Great Quality, Great Value ; Japanese capacitors : 100 percent
